column4: I installed windows after ubuntu and now I can't boot into ubuntu. What do I do.
do you have a livecd?
no just installation cd.
no I just got installation cd
youll probably want to burn either knoppix or ubuntu livecd although you can reinstall grub from floppy
I'm not a complete newbie, I'm not affraid to work from command line. I've done this before just forgot the sequence of events.
checkout https://wiki.ubuntu.com/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows
thanks.
free will tell you then you can just swapon /dev/something
so just do free /dev/hda2 (which is my swap)?
just free  if it shows swap youre fine if not you need to sudo swapon   then make sure its in fstab as well for reboot
is it a big app? we talking like over 2 or 4 gigs mem needed?
free shows swap like this: Swap:            0          0          0
it's eclipse
yeah you need to set swap then.  also gksudo gedit /etc/fstab  and add an entry there for it so its auto used next reboot
and fstab is using some UUID crap that is like a code it's not /dev/hda2 or something simple
you can use uui or replace with hda2 or whatever
# /dev/hda2 -- converted during upgrade to edgy
how do I obtain the uuid of /dev/hda2?
honestly id remove the uuid and just do /dev/hda2
but the rest of fstab has UUID
